Section.Catchline: Recordkeeping and identification of trust property.

Subsection.Text: A trustee shall keep clear, distinct, and accurate records of the administration of the trust.
A trustee shall keep trust property separate from the trustee’s own property.

Except as otherwise provided in subsection (4), a trustee shall cause the trust property to be designated so that the interest of the trust, to the extent feasible, appears in records maintained by a party other than a trustee or beneficiary.
If the trustee maintains records clearly indicating the respective interests, a trustee may invest as a whole the property of two or more separate trusts.
